Transcription for 18939

It is said that Frampton is named after the Frampton family, or the De Frampton family.
One of the members, Adam De Frampton, was said to have killed Llewellyn, the last Welsh
prince, and took his head to Rutherland, and thence to the Tower of London.
He was so hated for this that he had to go into hiding.
He was so frightened that he took to riding around the Vale of Glamorgan at great speed.
And one day his horse stumbled and he fell and was killed.
It is said that the hooves can still be heard on the road where he fell.
